block.p: Earthlink, which has not had a permanent chief executive since Garry Betty died of cancer in January at the age of 49, is dangling unusual incentives before five of its top executives.

Call them ''please don't leave before the new boss is chosen'' bonuses. Michael C. Lunsford, the interim president and chief executive, will collect $400,000 if he stays until May 1 and an additional $300,000 if he is still with Earthlink on Jan. 1, 2009.

Four other senior executives stand to collect a total of $2.3 million if they stay on through next year or until the day the new boss fires them, whichever comes first.
